intro: Molongum laxum, commonly known as the slender molongu, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Molongum laxum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
